title: How to Sign a PDF on iPhone

steps.title: Open your PDF in Markup.
steps.content: Open your PDF in Markup. To do this, open the Files app and long-press on your PDF. Once the menu slides up from the bottom of your screen, tap Markup . [1] X Research source If you quickly tap the file instead, it will open and you'll see a marker-tip icon in the top right corner. You can tap that to open Markup.

steps.title: Tap +.
steps.content: Tap + . You'll see this plus sign in the bottom right corner of your screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Signature.
steps.content: Tap Signature . If you already have signatures, you can drag and drop the one you prefer onto your document. If you don't have signatures, draw on the screen of your phone to create a signature that you can later drag to reposition on the PDF. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's in the top left corner of your screen and will close Markup and save your changes. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open the document you want to sign in Adobe Sign.
steps.content: Open the document you want to sign in Adobe Sign. This app icon looks like a stylized "A" next to "Sign" on a purple background. You'll need a subscription to use this service, which offers more secure e-signatures (like certificate-based digital signatures). If you're starting an Acrobat Standard DC or Acrobat Pro DC subscription for the first time, you can get a 7-day free trial. If you don't have the Adobe Sign app, you can get it for free from the App Store. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap .
steps.content: Tap . You'll see the pencil icon at the bottom of your screen, towards the right.

steps.title: Tap Fill & Sign.
steps.content: Tap Fill & Sign . This will allow you to add your signature to the PDF. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Select Create Signature.
steps.content: Select Create Signature . The screen will adjust to allow you to use the entire screen so you don't have to create a small signature. Tilt your phone in landscape mode (it'll be longer than it is tall) to continue. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Draw.
steps.content: Tap Draw . You'll see this option at the top of your screen, which will allow you to use your finger or stylus to draw on the screen of your phone. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . You'll see this in the top right corner of your screen and your signature will be saved for any future documents. [9] X Research source The app will try to place your signature at the appropriate size and in the right spot, but you can drag and drop or pinch it to move it around or make it bigger. [10] X Research source
